lenders.name: Ginger
lenders.loan_because: I have done a lot of reading lately about the downside of foreign aid.  All articles have pointed to microfinance in general (and kiva.org specifically) as a system that works.  I love the reach that this gives me - I would otherwise have no way to learn about the needs around the world.  Capitalizing on the awesome power of the collective makes changing the lives of others accessible to people of all walks of life.  This is truly the best thing since sliced bread! :)
lenders.occupational_info: I help the sales team at a legal technology consulting company.

lenders.name: Geir
lenders.loan_because: It might do someone some good.

lenders.name: Marco Tulio
lenders.loan_because: I have problems to invest in spare parts to give to credibility and major confidence, fast attention, problems to mobilize me to the capital to bring spare parts today and with this crisis
lenders.occupational_info: my work is preventive maintenance and corrective of computers independent, work from my house, I have an old computer but that is very good to support to me, my factory is small

lenders.name: Laurence
lenders.loan_because: it is now becoming so easy to help that I cannot anymore hide myself behind senseless excuses. I'm so spoiled by life. It does not cost me anything to help and it actually means a lot for others. With just a few clicks on my computer, I know that the life of someone, somewhere is changing for the better and that makes me  feel good.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm working for eBay for the finance department  of PayPal. I would have loved to use their MicroPlace site but they do not offer it to non-US residents as of now. I'm happy that this site is offering PayPal as a mean of payment. It is so easy.

lenders.occupational_info: I work with kids.  All kids, but especially with the ones that need extra help.
